data.title: We only tried the desserts (because we had already eaten dinner), but they were awesome!
data.text: We were visiting Omaha and wanted to try this restaurant.  Unfortunately, there were no timely dinner reservations available, so we stopped by and carried out desserts to share.  They were incredible, especially the Death By Chocolate dessert.  Highly recommend.

data.title: This is a must-try restaurant!
data.text:
You will probably have your doubts when you read that this is a vegan restaurant but please don't let that keep you from trying this restaurant. It's charming decor - think high-end hippie style is a lovely setting for a delicious meal. The wait staff is very nice, eager to tell you the specials and to share ingredients with you. There are beer and cocktails if you choose. And then the food, which will really surprise you. 

Our table ordered the Mushroom Reuben, the Shepherd's Pie and Pesto Gnocchi. Each entree was delicious and the sides such as grilled corn and seared turnips were incredibly good. I really had doubts when it came to desserts. We ordered two: peanut butter chocolate pie and modern sundae. I thought the coconut whip was no replacement for whipped cream, not worth doing as far as I was concerned. But both the pie and ice creams were creamy and flavorful and a perfect ending to a delicious meal.

data.title: Great Vegan
data.text: The place is fabulous.   The setting is very comfy--you feel like it is someone's home.  The service is friendly.  But the food is the true star.  Salads and apps are great (the kale salad with avocado is one of our faves).  Soups are always good.  The vegan mac and cheese is to die for, and the sloppy joes are outstanding.  There are many gluten free options as well.  Parking can sometimes be an issue.  But highly recommended.

data.title: I'm torn on this one...
data.text:
For the good: I was super excited to eat a restaurant where I actually had options and didn't have to check ingredients on everything. While I'm vegetarian, not vegan, it was nice to be at a place I "belonged." The place is super cute - very nicely decorated. Our server (I can't remember his name) was AMAZING, very polite, and very attentive! The food was plated and garnished beautifully as well.

For the bad: Maybe it was because I've been building up excitement to go there for the last few months (we're from out of town) but I didn't think it was anything too special. The seitan "wings" were really very good, but the rest of the food was too rich and over-seasoned, with some weird flavors (that all ran together because of the plating), and generally just nothing too exciting (my husband had a burger and I had the mac n shews). Maybe we're not just used to vegan food? Or maybe I ordered the wrong dish? It was also pretty expensive, which is fine for a nicer restaurant, but I didn't feel the food was worth the price. My only other complaint would be that while it was beautifully decorated, you are really close to the people next to you so it was hard to have a conversation at all.

Overall, I'm not sure if I'd go back or not. I'd maybe go back just to try some of their other appetizers and desserts. Or maybe try another entree?

data.title: Disappointed
data.text:
Ok, I'll start out by saying, While I won't be going back again perhaps the dinner could taste better than the appetizers. 
I got the mushroom chimichurri and the Brussels & bacon. The Brussels were very vinegary tasting and both items were just "eh".
Aside from that, I think it's important to know:
The location isn't ideal and parking, even for just picking up, is a pain. 
Also the front desk guy took my card gave me the receipt to sign and just kind of left me hanging there?! "Do I get my food? Which one is it? What do I do with the paper you just gave me to sign?" I had to ask a waitress to find out.
A little disappointment bc I was really looking forward to trying this place.

data.title: If you don't think Vegan food can possibly be delicious, try Modern Love
data.text: We had the Kale Cesar Salad, Seitan Wings, Seitan chop, Gnocchi and Blueberry Crumble.  They were all amazing!!  My wife has been vegetarian for 8 years, but I'm relatively new to trying to make plant based foods a bigger part of my diet.  The visit to this little restaurant has opened my eyes further to how delicious vegan food can be.  I wish we didn't live 900 miles away from here!  The staff all looked like they loved working there and they made us feel very welcomed and well looked after.  One little hint, call ahead and make a reservation - it usually booked up and we were lucky that they snuck us in to sit at a little window bar they had.  Can't say enough about this little gem - great food, great value, and great people!.

data.title: Vegan food done right!
data.text:
This review is only for the food (no service, ambiance, etc), since we ordered food to go. 
We had the vegetable tagine, which was very good), and seitan with marsala sauce (good, very filling). We are not strictly vegetarians/vegans, just try not to eat too much meat. I can say that you can certainly bring someone who eats meat here and they will find something good. The food we had was prepared very well, with the textures and flavors of everything being excellent.  Even the presentation (for a to go order, it was beautiful!). It's very hard to find AN ITEM on an entire menu that's vegan, never mind a restaurant! And this place was delicious! I remember it being pretty pricey, but considering the fact that the food ethically sourced, using seasonal produce, etc...The price is probably fair. I would eat here regularly, but unfortunately we live in another state. It was an outstanding meal.

data.title: LOVE IT
data.text:
I absolutely love Modern Love. The food is unparalleled in quality, filling beyond belief, and refreshingly ethically sourced. Everything on the menu is either vegetarian or vegan, but omnivores won't be disappointed- the meat alternatives are incredibly tasty & satisfying. 
It's a pretty small restaurant & its gaining in popularity, so I would recommend getting online & making a reservation for the time you'd like to dine so you're not left standing around waiting for a table in the tiny entry space. 
The staff is friendly & hip. They are generally pretty knowledgable about the locally sourced ingredients & the specially crafted recipes. They also are serving alcohol now! 
The price range is pretty high. If you're poor like me, this is more of a special treat restaurant.

data.title: Unique and tasty
data.text: I'm a vegetarian and was accompanied by someone who eats meat with every meal, and we were both really impressed. The menu has unique items and everything was very flavorful. The staff is super friendly, the ambiance is nice and relaxed, and the prices are reasonable. If I'm in Omaha again I'll definitely go back.

data.title: Worth a drive
data.text:
Multiple friends in the area recommended Modern Love, including some who drive from Kansas City just to eat here! It was definitely worth a visit. Lots of creativity in the dishes and pretty friendly to meat-eaters too. (My caveat for carnivores is to try something that's not pretending to be meat. The burger is really tasty, but if you're not accustomed to vegetarian iterations of them, you're likely to be frustrated that it doesn't taste or feel like beef.) 

Prices are fairly steep (about $18 for an entree), but they are worth it. You're getting things you can't get anywhere else. Plus, the kitchen has to make a lot of staple ingredients themselves in order to be vegan. 

The restaurant is small, so be sure to make reservations!

data.title: Scrumptious & Snazzy
data.text:
I followed Isa Moskowitz (the owner) back when she created the 'Post Punk Kitchen' show and was putting out her first two cookbooks. I've been looking forward to getting the opportunity to eat at Modern Love for a long time. I made reservations a couple weeks in advance and, (regardless of the size of your party) I highly suggest you do so as well since the restaurant is cozy and compact in nature.

Everything about this place is warm and inviting. The overall ambiance, the food, everyone (staff and guests alike) are content which added to the overall aesthetic and experience. Our server was not only extremely attentive all throughout our visit but was also genuinely friendly. 

We order the 'Modern Cheeseburger' and the 'Spring Vegetable Tagine' both dishes were plated artfully and each was packed with unique flavor. My boyfriend (newly Vegan) was astounded at how realistic not only the taste was of the burger but also the texture and its appearance. The Veggie Tagine was also a delight, the freshness of the vegetables accompanied the lentil and rice stew excellently. 

We order the 'Lemon Lavender cheesecake' and the 'Coconut Lime Cream Pie' for dessert (you can't not get dessert!) I was impressed with both. The cheesecake hit the pallet just right; it was incredibly smooth, creamy and slightly sweet. The pie was a perfect balance of tang and sweetness, with a light and fluffy texture. 

Vegan or not, I highly recommend you give this place a try. Without a doubt one of the best meals I've ever had, will definitely be returning.

data.title: Absolutely Delicious!
data.text: Trip Advisor recommended Modern Love, and so did a waitress in the Old Market.  We have to say that it was a remarkable dinner!  We had the deviled chickpeas appetizer and it was fantastic!  We also had the mac & shews (cashew) and the Gnocchi and while they were quite different from each other, both were fantastic.  We shared the blueberry desert and it was indescribably delicious!  Modern Love is not just for vegetarians - I would recommend it to anyone that is looking for a remarkable meal in a very quaint restaurant.  I think the whole place would fit in a two-stall garage, so you need reservations.

data.title: AMAZING!
data.text: My boyfriend and I went recently, he is vegetarian and I am vegan. HOLY SMOKES! This place was a delight! The food was soooo good with great texture and variety. The desert was wonderful too! Our server was very nice, however she did seems a little uncomfortable serving, like maybe she was new. You must visit for the amazing food! Skip the wine, go for water (the wine selection is not good.) I had an amazing gnocchi with asparagus and many other greens, pesto, and pine nuts. He had a very hearty potatoes, mushroom dish that I think would make any meat eater turn vegan! Its great!

data.title: Surprisingly good
data.text: As a meat-eater, I went to this restaurant to try it out with a friend. I was VERY skeptical and expecting it to be weird and mostly vegetables. However, the sandwich I got was absolutely delicious, made with tofu they make themselves. It also had a very appealing texture. Dessert was also delicious. One of the more unique restaurants in Omaha, and non vegans will love it, you just have to have an open mind when ordering. Other reviewers are right, tables are oriented very close to one another.

data.title: All vegan restaurant really tries to entice you into a animal free existance
data.text:
Modern Love really tries to provide dishes to wide variety of taste. The dishes are carefully prepared and well flavored. I had the kale salad with smoked tofu which I thought was bit bland. The seitan wings and enchiladas were excellent. The other dishes seemed less than we expected. Overall, I thought chef was being a bit timid with spices. Other than wings, nothing had any sort of zip or zing to distinguish it. My daughter who had been before said it wasn't their best night.

I might have given it 4 stars except the waiter had such an attitude. He pretty much ignored us until the restaurant emptied out. We would have ordered significantly more food, but he just wasn't around. My wife felt he decided I was out of place and he wasn't going to deal with my type. I don't know, but he sure didn't make anyone feel welcomed our party.

In full disclosure, I'm a carnivore who does try to limit red meat, but I'm married to vegan, my daughter is vegan, and my son is mostly vegetarian. We had family friend who is also a vegetarian. I also cook a lot of vegetarian recipes, so while it is not my daily diet, I'm not inexperienced.

Based on other reviewers and the national reputation, I'd say my experience is due to bad night in the kitchen and a server with a bad attitude. If I'm in Omaha, I'd probably try again just to see if it really was an off night.

data.title: Interesting Dinner
data.text: The place is small but didn't feel crowded. The food was interesting and I enjoyed the meal; if you need to eat something that was once propelling itself, eat somewhere else. I had a burger that was good but if you are a real meat eater looking for a similar flavor and texture, you will not be happy. The fries are awesome! The service was great and overall I would suggest trying the place for a change of pace. I am not a vegan so I may not be rating the place fairly.

data.title: Never again!
data.text: I and a friend ordered a Modern Cheeseburger that consisted of a lentil patty, smoky cashew cheddar, dill pickles, tomato, whole wheat bun, fatty fries, miso ketchup. When our plates arrived everything looked very tasty and then when I took a bite the lentil patty squeezed out of the sides and oozed out onto my finger's and fell onto my plate. I was expecting a patty that was firm and not soft. It also was a red color and looked like a raw hamburger. The flavor was very bland and the only thing that tasted some what eatable was the bun, but even it was too hard. It also had lettuce that was not fresh and was wilted. The potato's that came with it where cut to thick and even the root-beer drink we ordered didn't taste right. We had a pitcher of water at our table and there was no ice in it and it tasted like tap water. It is a small place and the seating was very limited and the tables were too close together. I told the lady that served us that the food didn't taste good and she told us she appreciated the feedback and would let the cook know. No apologize at all. I have been vegetarian for 15 yrs and I have ate countless veggie burgers and what was served to us was not a burger. We should have just left after the first bite of our food and not paid almost $50 dollars for the worst meal I have ever had. Both of us suffered from sick stomachs for several hours after eating part of the burgers. I was really expecting a good meal based on the reviews I read but had a completely opposite experience,

data.title: Loved it, will return
data.text:
My husband and I made reservations here on a Friday night for our anniversary. I can say everything was better than expected.  We were seared right away. Other reviewers are correct that you do sit extremely close to the next table. You may as well be sitting together. 

My husband ordered the modern cheeseburger and I had the vegetable chickpea korma. The flavor of the korma was hands down amazing.  The chutney that was on the side really added depth to the whole thing. The modern cheeseburger was good too and there were more than enough fat fries on the side.

I really wanted to try a dessert, but was more than full with just the entree. 

Overall we had a great dinner and would come back again. We are both omnivores but were not missing the meat due ti the flavor and depth of our dishes.

data.title: Vegan paradise
data.text:
I have been here before and as history would have it, my meal was again delicious. Started off with asparagus hollandaise. Fresh and light. Potato Gnocchi was the entree- spice hit my throat right off the bat (cough) but after my tastebuds were primed, all of the delicious flavors were dancing. I finished with Chocolate caramel cheesecake- what a treat, so decadent.
My leftovers today will be so special!

data.title: An excellent restaurant for all!
data.text:
I visited Modern Love with a group of colleagues/friends with an out-of-town guest to impress . . .  and she was quite impressed by Modern Love, as we all were!   We were there on a Tuesday night and it was still quite busy -- reservatations are essential if you have a group.  We started with the Roasted Garlic Hummus.  This was a delicious and nice size portion -- just right for the six of us to share as an appetizer.  Their homemade flatbread was very good and the veggies a nice contrast to the creamy hummus.  We ordered a variety of entrees and passed them around so we could all try . . . and we were all pleased with the results.  The Mac & Shews, Chickpea Vegetable Korma and Potato Gnocchi were all delicious.  The Mac & Shews will not make you forget a rich and creamy macaroni and cheese . . . but the tasty balance of flavors of the pasta, the roasted BBQ cauliflower, crispy tofu and the kale were wonderful.  The almond ricotta on the Potato Gnocchi was amazing . . . 

For dessert we shared a variety of their offerings -- the Fig & Pear Crumble Pie, the Lemon Coconut Cream Pie and the Caramel Mocha Cheesecake.  The Fig & Pear Crumble Pie was outstanding.  I will order my own slice next time!  The Lemon Coconut Cream Pie was also very good.  The Cheesecake was my least favorite . . . it was good but no substitute for the real thing.

Overall, an outstanding dinner.  Don't be scared off by the lack of meat . . . you won't miss it at all!
